lines.text: You just see a windmill of legs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Instead I just write: "Well, why didn't you come?" And then I close the book. I go back inside after a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You all finish a very necessary long night's rest. Coming to consciousness as the dome vanishes, exposing the center of the base floor walkway, where Caleb had set up both the protections of his spells and the dome in the first place. Beau has not returned.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Atta girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all wake up. The front door which is right across from where you are is partially ajar, partway open.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go outside and get some fresh air and see what I see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see faint footsteps leading from the gate to where you are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they deep, heavy dwarf footprints?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are, and they're heading away from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rub my thumb along the lucky rock in my pocket, and smile at the snow and think about playing in it when I was younger, and go inside to wake up anyone who's still sleeping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Beau, at one point you did wake up this morning. Halfheartedly, as some people aren't as stealthy in their exits as others.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cling clang, clung clung!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Open one eye and glance over, and the door closes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I chuckle and roll over and go back to sleep. Smile as I dig into my pillow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You all come to consciousness as Caleb wakes you. On the outskirts of the dome by where Nott was sleeping, there is a tiny little piece of paper.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's a note! For me! It's really badly written. It's like Frankenstein wrote a letter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Name is spelled wrong, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Sory."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "This medalon, medalion, medallon-- this thing, was from Yuto. It will protect you. Thank "you for helping me. Keg. P.S. If anyone hurts you I will kill them." "Kill" is spelled wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is, underneath the paper where you pulled it away, you saw it was a medallion that was hanging from the bottom of her warhammer. It has a symbol of a star or a sun of multiple points sticking out on all sides.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take it and put it around my neck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am now invincible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Medallion of stogies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Medallion of five o'clock shadow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have to have one character in every campaign that grows facial hair for no reason.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You fucking know it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A charmed bracelet of dwarvenkind? Just gets a little bit of stubble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you cast Identify on the ruby thingy at all?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I didn't do nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, you wake up and there is a letter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking secret Santa in this bitch!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hope it's a terrible drawing of some-- sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys, I've never gotten morning after-- (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (wheezing) That's fucking great!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's almost as good as the Kerrek letter, you guys!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The immediate regret! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, you've got to have the full experience. First off, "For Bo," spelled wrong.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (reading) "Bo," everything's crossed out, "Thanks." (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those letters were actually written by Ashly Burch for you guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah?! Oh, amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "I love--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can see it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can see it! She was trying to write, "Your eyes are beautiful when you smile. I love-- Thanks." (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Amazing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll cherish this forever.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I forgot to ask. Before we do anything else, Lorenzo's glaive, his weapon, did we get that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was left below, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we grabbed it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you have it. It's a wicked looking weapon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just give it to me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll go grab it and give it to Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (muttering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is not magical.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is magical, in that it is very finely crafted. But it doesn't do anything expect cut me across the chest quite deeply.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, that bag is way better than my bag.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's pretty big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could always dye that one pink too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't have to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can help with that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, probably.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can dye things colors?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, possibly it could work. I don't know, yeah maybe. Probably.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have a long way to walk, so is that what we're doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we going?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! We have to finish the thing for The Gentleman, oh my gosh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay. We already got in touch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But also we should go back to Ophelia Mardun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With Ophelia Mardun, who was-- yes that's what I was about to say.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Glad you guys are keeping track.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much time do we left on that thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're doing okay. We already got in touch with Ophelia, who is the woman we were supposed to get in contact with. We were like a day or so late, but she was fine with it. But she wanted us to go kill Lorenzo and the rest of the Iron Shepherds, so it was a very convenient killing one group of slavers with one stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You came to get the money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no! We came to save you, the money's the bonus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, Nott! I know you did. I was just joking with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it is true. The money meant fuck all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is literally the first they've mentioned it in my presence, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That means you get all of the money.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eh, I'm fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody's so generous here! You can give me all of the platinum, then. I don't mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, that is incorrect. I would like my share of the platinum to be sure. Any coin that we found, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Divide it up now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus, can I ask what your involvement is? How you became involved in this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go so far as to say I feel that the fates have intertwined us for a while. I need to head east at some point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What is east?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything's telling me that I should stick around and see where you're headed. I think that's where I'm supposed to be.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Didn't we promise to do something for you, like give you our blood or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We never really discussed the finer points. I assumed that you were a vampire and that you were going to suck our blood.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He makes dead people tea. It's very nice tea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He makes what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He makes tea out of things that grow on corpses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cemetery tea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Interesting point, too. Some of the corpses you passed by in the middle of the arena were starting to be overgrown with fungus. It's quite disgusting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You make dead people into tea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, they're going to do it eventually anyway. I just usher the process along a little bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it good tea?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very good tea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's pretty good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair I think we've had two rounds of it at this point. I've been making breakfast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Honestly, you could make a lot of money setting up a shop somewhere and selling tea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Huh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't tell them it's dead people tea, and then wait until they drink it and then go, "Guess "what that was made from!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, all tea is really dead people tea when you think about it, so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we going to go to Ophelia first and then to Mollymauk, or?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ophelia first, then Mollymauk. It's all along the way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sounds good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we wait for Yasha to wake up, or do we bring her with?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shoot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's got a day and a spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're all dead, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All the horses are gone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I figured.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, W.C.?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: W.C.'s gone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Crapper, John.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's in the fields.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the worst.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kind of already was, but yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we have a new lease on life. We have new horses, we have a new day. Let's go name some horses and steal them!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sounds good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We steal horses. We make a nice little bed for Yasha and lay her down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We carry her out to the cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I put her in the Bag of Holding and-- (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there invisible cages on the carts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you go ahead and check, the carts still appear to be saddled up with the cages. When you approach, it looks to be small bundles of produce and various packs, but upon reaching the edge and peering in, your face immediately goes past the illusion and you see the tarp, a heavy tarp that's laid over the cages. Pulling it open, the cages are still there in the cart, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The cages are invisible, or whatever's in the tarp is invisible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can tell, whatever's under the tarp is invisible. Everything in the cart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we break down the cages easily, or bring the cages off the cart?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're pretty large cages. They're 6-foot by 4-foot by 4-foot. They're stacked up two at a time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we get rid of them, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yeah. You pull off the cages and pull off the tarp, and they all come out of the illusion, and they're normal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we put the tarp back up and get under the tarp and see if we can see each other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get under the tarp, and you're under a tarp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I stay outside and look in?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not the tarp that's the source of the illusion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see all your friends getting under a tarp.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I put my hand through the cage bar. Do I see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what's invisible now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wait, you guys pulled the cages and the tarp off the cart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, nothing seems to be changed. The cart still looks like it's filled with some small bundles--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get up on the cart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The cart's magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Jester steps into the cart, she vanishes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have an invisible cart! How long will this last?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you see me right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just give me ten goddamn minutes. Identify the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How does it work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What it is, is it's a localized illusion to give a fake interior appearance of a cart, but that enchantment has been made permanent through some other magical means.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll take it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stealth cart!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Between the stealth cart and the dome, we're going to be rolling dirty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, how long was the ride from Shady Creek to this compound? Like three or four hours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From Shady Creek? It's only about an hour or so. From Ophelia's, it's about an hour and a half by foot. By cart, you're not too sure. These woods can be thick and hard to get through in large carts.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, so slower by cart because--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slower by cart because you're having to ferry it through some more difficult terrain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. But worth it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grab some stuff from the kitchen, some blankets from upstairs, some pillows so you can actually be comfortable in the cart. Yeah. Be nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You grab two of the horses that are still set up on the exterior, you get them forded to the cart. You guys throw your cushions and blankets into the back. Who's going to be guiding the cart? There is still the front where the actual seat is where you can hold the reins and steer it where it goes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll sit up front.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Caduceus and Caleb up front, the rest in the back?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take one of the other horses.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to take four horses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so nobody's in the cart. Except for Yasha.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need horses to pull the cart, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That is important, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two horses on the cart, two horses that are free, ridden by--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caduceus and Caleb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're on the cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right. I'll ride a horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll ride a horse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's kind of awesome. We need you guys to jump over to the Twitch chat on Critical Role, that's twitch.tv/criticalrole, during the break and enter, only once, the keyword tonight, which is "reunion."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Reunion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was good! Snaps for that one!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No snaps for that one!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was almost forensic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never felt anything like that before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, everyone. Laura will be back when she finishes feeding the baby.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I feel like Lorenzo had his way with me just now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, we do have our winner of the giveaway at the break. It is LandonFoster1. Congratulations.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nice try, Foster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, he's trying to win his own giveaways. Damn it! We'll have that sent to you ASAP. We'll contact you and get your information and congrats for your new Wyrmwood dice box coming your way. All righty. Y'all--

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Happy Birthday Ashley!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes! For those who didn't know, it is Ashley Johnson's birthday.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Today!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could have said it, too!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The reason we're not overflowing with "Happy Birthday" joy and radiance is because we also have a cold, dead, fury that she's not at the table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we wanted her here badly, but her shoot schedule did not allow it. We wish her happy birthday on social media and such. She is amazing and we love her, and we want her back ASAP.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Ashley, come back!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thankfully, the enchantment on the cart enables you to do so without much issue. However, it is also a very populated area with friends and enemies of the house you are traveling to. Who wants to be responsible for trying to remain inconspicuous?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Remain inconspicuous, you mean in the open, not hidden by the illusion of the cart?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, well, you still have four of you who are out in the open. Two on horseback, and two actually bringing the cart forward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Weird question. The carts aren't sprayed on the side with "Iron Shepherds?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no branding we have to worry about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: White Stallions! There's a Death Star painted on the side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a Jesus fish.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll flip my coat inside out to my brown side and put up the hood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I look like a peasant, I'll stay put.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join the somewhat inconspicuous-looking humans attempting to create a uniform similar to Beau's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit! You can do that too, huh?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you going to do that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll make myself a disheveled brunet-looking guy with a sick-ass goatee.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me and Jester will be in the invisibility cone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take everything I just said back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to do each other's hair, and make faces at everyone else in the group.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Birds galore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With your preparation, it doesn't seem that you catch too much attention, thankfully. You do eventually make your way to the outskirts of the two-story Estate Sybaritic where you see the familiar dark red wood and the fence with six-inch spear tips still aggressively daring anybody to vault over or make entry. The guards that you had previously encountered when you first arrived immediately turn, and you see the two on the inside of the courtyard, and the one that's outside of the gate as another one appears to be stepping into his position he had left for a moment. All look over as you begin to approach, get their crossbows ready. One of the guards at the very front, the one that's on the outside of the wall already, begins to approach with his hand on the side of a sheathed blade. "Who goes there?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are we doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good evening. Good day. Good afternoon. We are expected by Miss Mardun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please wait here, I'll be right back. I'm going to go check." He closes the gate behind him, locks it, leaves you there, and the two other guards keep their crossbows at the ready, but not aimed. Just careful and ready to go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've met with her already?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How did it go?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Very well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's super hot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: True.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You'll have to leave your cart here."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that's not doable. Do you have a wider gate around back or something like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll keep an eye on it. It's not going anywhere."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You personally?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes! It's my job. I'm stationed literally right here."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hope you have some extra hands. We're going to be picking up very heavy equipment and lugging it all the way from the house back to the gate if we can't bring the cart in. I don't mind, it's just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, we can muster a few additional hands."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (coughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll go ahead and put in the request."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know this cart like the back of my hand, and if one inch of it is touched, I will know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do not worry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would tell this cart that we'll be right back. Stay put, cart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cooing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's very personal with the cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's tight across in the front. She's in more of a leisurely appearance, but she descends, one hand on the front of the robe, the other slightly gliding down the banister, looking over this strange bunch that have entered. Recognizing you two, not recognizing you two, and says so as she begins to descend down the final bit of the staircase. "I see some familiar faces, but, "strangely, some I do not. Who are your friends before I come any closer?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, as I said on our previous meeting, we have vetted appropriate people for the task at hand, which has been completed. That is all you need to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Completed, you say? Are you to tell me that these Iron Shepherds have been dealt with?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everyone other than the common folk that they had taken away have been put to the blade or burnt to cinders.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And what proof have you brought me?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I open up the Bag of Holding and pull out Lorenzo's glaive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fetch it for me." One of the guards comes over and puts his hands on the glaive and waits for you to release it. He walks over and hands it to Ophelia. She grasps it and (grunts). It's got some heft to it. She takes it and looks it over, "Very well. You are absolutely certain there are "no signs left behind to trace it? No one saw you? No one followed you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know the one who wields that weapon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know of the one that did, yes."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This one broke his jaw almost off of his face, and then his skull was burned to ash. We murdered everyone in that house who was not a farmer. It is empty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check with advantage. She wants to believe you, but is--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her yellow eyes darken into slits as she inspects you. For that brief, pregnant pause in conversation, you feel this probing stare. You cannot see where the pupils glance, but you feel like you are being looked up and down, and then every aspect of your facial expressions and mannerisms being instantaneously processed. She leans back comfortably in her stance, now previously with an intense force of confrontational energy, she now seems to relax, takes the glaive and hands it off to one of her guards and says, "Please prepare that for mounting "within my collection."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Um. If you don't mind, it would actually be greatly appreciated to us if we kept that for the fallen member of our party.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Very well. Leave it with them please." The guard that was taking it off turns around and brings it back and hands it to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's very kind of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Zemas!" she shouts off, down one of the hallways, and you see a servant rush around the corner, "Yes?" "Prepare two carriages and a package for entry to the Empire. We shall be gone for a couple "of weeks to secure business with a contact of mine. Notify Anselm of my absence, please. We "leave at dusk." "Of course, my lady," and he rushes off. "Are you ready to leave at dusk?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want us to go with you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was under the impression, based on my contacts with The Gentleman, that we were to "return together."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right, we were supposed to escort her back. Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are amenable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is just fine. There are more of us waiting a ways away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How many? I've only called two carriages: one for myself and one for you. Do you require more?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have three more, drei.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So a third carriage? It becomes a bit conspicuous in travel."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we have come with our own means of transportation. We can travel with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. Two carriages, same as said before. I will prepare, collect my things. I "suggest you do the same. We leave soon. I am excited to travel alongside you." She smiles, turns, and begins to ascend the steps.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What in the hot fuck is going on with her?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think hot fuck is actually very appropriate on a few levels.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (clears throat) You could keep some of those puns in your head, you know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why does she want to leave? This can't be good, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We were supposed to escort her back. I'm sure she has more business with The Gentleman, no?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, the job is the job. We will be watching our own backs regardless, but the job is the job.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We were going to stop on the way back, though, weren't we?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not too much to ask.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's along the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the job. This is what brought you up here? Interesting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not that this was really the job, it was more like there were two jobs. You had to accept both as opposed to one or the other, and the one was doable and we did it, and the other one--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bit off more than we could chew by us saying yes to both.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boy, I wonder how long before Ophelia's ready to go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, she said the morning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dusk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, right now, based on how early in the afternoon it is, gives you roughly about two and a half, three hours before dusk hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we'll wait for her outside the gates? With our cart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is there anything you guys wish to do or prepare while you're waiting for her to join you outside of the estate?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anybody.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the sticks, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Imagine this is like the sparse, gated community of the lawless city. The northern side of the street is where most of the houses live, the various feuding factions. It's where the money goes. Right around the road, especially south of it and east of it, is where you start getting into the slums and the folks that exist here because they have no other choice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The guards, or the people that she has working for her, are they wearing any sort of face protection, head protection, or is it open?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ones outside do have a very simple leather cap with heavy straps, like a Roman-type style, that descend past the sides of the chin, but that's about it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask, in your previous engagements with her, how far are we trusting her?

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Eh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, superficial, yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not at all, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that everyone in this town is dangerous, so eyes wide open.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you guys probably didn't see a lot, considering you were in cages when you came through, but this is a shitty shit-hole. Like a really shitty shit-hole.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do live here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You live in a very nice garden an hour north of here. The city is garbage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you spend time in the-- no, you have been alone--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You haven't left in 18 years!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I've left. I just haven't left in a while. I've got to come to town sometimes. Get things, get supplies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It still stands: it's pretty shitty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and good things come from shit, right? Like flowers?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to have to make a little confession. I really haven't been many other places, so I suppose I really don't actually have a great basis of comparison.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You didn't travel much?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No-- oh yeah, I haven't traveled much at all.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's been living in a cemetery--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Living?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Exclusively for a number of years.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is very beautiful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still a cemetery, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We asked this, I'm sure. You're-- (whispering) He's alive, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He is. We asked the same question.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very much so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (strained) Cool, yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, the smell comes with it. It's got a little musk? Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Musty as shit? Yeah, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's strong at first, but--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like sandalwood, kind of?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, but you get used to it and it mellows the longer you're around him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When you two mix together, it has this meatloaf smell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It has not been that long since I took a shower. I don't know why this running gag is continuing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this is happening, you guys are talking and spending time within the cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're doing each other's hair, and I'm using my Mending cantrip to fix up Yasha's clothes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is helping tremendously in the process.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But she's still lying unconscious?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's still unconscious. The enchantment does last for a protracted period of time. You do begin to hear a few pairs of horse hooves coming up louder, behind where the cart is currently set.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can they see the cart?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think they can see the cart. They just can't see us in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can they hear us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys can see outside of it because there is no tarp covering the space.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they look like they can hear us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You turn around and look. You don't know if they can hear you or not, but you see two rather extravagant-looking carriages making their way towards you. You can see this dark wood with gold detailing on the outsides. Each has a curtained window on the right and the left, sets of large, spoked wheels on each side, and each one has two horses affixed to the front. There is a driver at the front of each one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nott, moon them. Moon them right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. I will moon them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is no reaction, but you are, indeed, mooning them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs loudly) I mean, we laugh very quietly, just in case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, I rolled really bad on my stealth check. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one older fellow, his nose has grown over time to the point where it's overpowering the front of his face, and he's got this rough, white hair across his chin where he hasn't shaved in a bit, but he's dressed raggedly, though nice? If you imagine one of the ghosts in Haunted Mansion before it died, it's how he's dressed, and as it (horse clopping), he hears you laughing and he looks, "Hello?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha wakes up: (startles)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Behind her, you see two other guards carrying a number of packed handbags. She points, "All right, "please place them-- the front one is mine-- within there." They start loading the bags up into the carriage, up on top of it. One of the guys are lifting the other up and they are passing the bags along as he's putting it up and they're strapping it down with rope across the top of it for travel until, eventually, she is escorted outside of the grounds. She looks to you all outside of the cart-- those that she can see, and she goes, "Should anyone ask along our journeys, I am Lady "Quinn Denzala of Nogvurot going to see my ailing mother in Deastok. You are my personal guard. If "you mess that up-- well, you may have more blood on your hands, so it would behoove you to pay "attention. Hmm?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course, Quinn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other carriage doors open and are left open for whoever would like to travel along with them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you guys going to go with her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need our cart to be driven--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can drive that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the two carriages?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's one carriage that's her's, and another carriage--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just hers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She does not want to travel with anybody. At least, not at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will enter the second carriage, if they are looking for people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that's Caleb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, just one--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That are sitting with her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, with her?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many that she wants to sit with her--?

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: She doesn't want anyone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She has her own carriage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think perhaps we are the intermediaries here. Why don't you ride with me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's still a horse that has to be ridden.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can tie it to the other ones.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll explain what's happening to the horses so that they move appropriately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can speak to the horses?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are hitching the horses to the other horses, Ophelia leans out of a window and goes: "This is intended to be nothing but a visitation travel, there is no reason to have "additional beasts. Do you care for your beasts? Are they sentimental to you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, not at all. Cut them loose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Cut them loose, and whatever you lose, I will happily repurchase for you when we arrive in Zadash."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not that we don't care for these animals, it's just that we cared for Water Closet, and Loo, and John way more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's missing a lot of context on that sentence.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just wanted you to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I appreciate your clarification."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But yeah, fuck these horses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Indeed." Closes the curtains on her window.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I explain this to the horses, I let them know what's going on; telling the two that they're ready to go about their business.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who's going to pull our carriage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have two horses on your cart, but there are the two being ridden separately. Those horses begin to wander off, finding their way through the Savalierwood southward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I named them and everything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're just going to be eaten, though! They're just horses.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, say goodbye to the two of your choosing, Nott.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, which ones?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Definitely Mamma Mia--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Got to keep Mamma Mia.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess Fernando and Waterloo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mamma Mia and Dancing Queen are staying with us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go, okay. As they wander off, you hear "Hyah!" (lashing, horse clopping), the carriages begin to pick up speed. Caduceus, you're driving the cart?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, give them a little: If you wouldn't mind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, it picks up as well, and now your train of two carriages and your cart begin to make their way southward, through Shadycreek Run. You guys begin to curve through the Clover Plaza, where you can see the bustle of the city is definitely making its way towards the latter half of the day. The sunset is cresting probably in the next hour or so. Keeping watch, the ones that are looking about would be-- Caduceus, you'd have a good view? You guys have a view throughout the illusion, so you three--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I interject for a second?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Since this is a lot of time that's passing, and it's just Beauregard and I in this carriage, can I, as a ritual spell, cast Detect Magic and check out the cart around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. You finish focusing on the spell and as you release your arcane incantation to sense the area around you, there's nothing about the cart that appears magical. Since you're focusing on that, and you are--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I guess I'm up front with Caduceus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, I would like you four-- or you three, and you to go ahead and roll perception checks, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 14. Jesus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, 21. But still good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The now gray and white city with the edges of the roads mucked with dirty snow and mud, being tracked through from all the foot and cart traffic. You do notice off to the sides near one of the inns or taverns that you have not had the opportunity to visit yet, within the Clover Plaza, you see a small gathering or meeting that catches your attention. You glance over and-- you wouldn't have context. Actually, none of you have the context for this. The two of you see a small meeting, between two really burly-looking figures in armor. A similar style-- or at least a haphazard patchwork-style of armor and adornments as some of the others that patrol the streets, keeping an eye out. Look like thugs a bit. You see two of them meeting with two figures that are in heavy cloak and hood. Because of your perceptive abilities, you notice that they are of a similar skin color as Ophelia. Their features are very fine, and their lithe bodies vanish within the heavy cloaks that guide them. You do see bits of armor protruding off the side of one that appear to be dark and insect-like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like the guy that we met down in the sewers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does. As you're watching out you see them discussing-- there is a brief transaction in the shadows of this alleyway and a handshake from the two cloaked figures and these two others. As you ride by and continue southward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shady deals happening over there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I've never seen one before. Are they buying--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. They're probably selling drugs to each other.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's cool. That's super cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait a minute-- (gasps) Wait a minute! Those were those guys!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which guys?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The guys that were-- (gasps) Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just saw one of those guys that had the thing!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The dodecahedron.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You saw a drow creature from Xhorhas? You saw a crick?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't say that! That's really rude. I saw them. They were over there, they had cloaks on and I saw them! What if they can sense us and they know that we have the thing that they're looking for? I keep looking at them to see if they notice us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She steps up to the captain of this watch. From a distance, they begin to have a conversation. You can't hear it. It's hushed voices, or at least not loud enough to reach your distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wish you could still read lips.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, that's what I was thinking: I can't read lips!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nah, that's the old campaign.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could sneak up and--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb, what about your cat?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you whispering to me through the doorway or--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm leaning over the carriage like: Hey what about your gato?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja (dying sound)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, look what I can do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am going to use-- what is the thing? The Cloak of Shadows? I'm going to use Cloak of Shadows on myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It gives you about 12 seconds of invisibility.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, that's it? Motherfucker, I thought it gave me a lot more than that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's until the end of your next turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah shit, it's in-battle. Hold on, look what I can do!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where'd you go? Oh my god! Oh hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best use of Channel Divinity in D&D history right there, ladies and gentlemen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it lasted longer than that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was really cool, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see that I went invisible?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were gone! It was crazy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've been thinking about that for a while.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Status quo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I was going to say: I do not miss Sam Riegel giving me shit about my spell usage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me. Once we're past the border, and time has passed, and the two Empire kids are sitting alone in this carriage. Caleb, staring out the window not even looking at Beauregard: Beauregard?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who are you? You know an awful lot about me now. You are not some (sigh) youth throwing themselves on drink, as you tried to claim when we first met. You are clearly tied to something greater than that. You are not some fuck-up. Who are you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's funny. I thought you were going to say something like, "Man, the Empire's sure fucked up." I was going to be like: Right? I was just thinking the same thing. It's just like what Jester said: we can read each other's thoughts.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a separate issue. We're very different, but not completely. I would feel a little safer if I knew a little more about you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, you know I'm a monk of the Cobalt Soul. I actually dumped a lot of this on Nott. She asked. We were a little tipsy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It doesn't happen often. She caught me in a perfect window.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Her or you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott did. Wait-- both? Nevermind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I was kind of a dick. So.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why are you out here in the wastelands?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I ran away from the Cobalt Soul and they gave me a raise in rank because of it. That was kind of cool. Really just further instilled my rebellion, to be totally honest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now you what? You want to follow the orders of the Cobalt Soul? You want to do whatever they ask you to do? Or something you want to do? Why are you running around with criminals? And me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My whole life was dictated by establishment that I didn't have a lot of control over. The Cobalt Soul has this underlying faction that helps uproot corrupt establishment. I know, I scoffed at the idea of being a part of a system that's supposed to take down systems. It doesn't really make sense, but you know. Maybe you, if anyone, can understand the idea of fighting fire with fire. That's why I'm doing this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is all orders you are following?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. They just want information. I'm out in the world at the ground level. People like us tend to have our fingers on the pulse of what's being said around the city sometimes. It's not necessarily something that a monk in full accolades can always accomplish.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A little bit of your own personal axe to grind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (repeating) Ja. Danke.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does that make you uncomfortable?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (exaggerated) Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, the carriages pull off to the side for the evening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me and Nott are having a dance party in ours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) That no one can see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (high pitched) I'm alive, I'm happy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ophelia doesn't leave her carriage, but eventually the carts and the two carriages are circled around a campfire. The drivers begin to cook their own meal and you are allowed to use the space to make what you wish.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have we made it outside the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are far beyond the city, you're beyond the Quannah Breach. You haven't reached the main road yet. You are just south of the breach, maybe by four hours or so. You're still north, north side if you want to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're still north of the Crispvale Thicket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like three days north.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll cook up what's there and we'll have a meal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where your hair begins to stand on your skin, and this deep, lead-like sinking sensation clenches the bottom of your stomach. As you've, a short time ago, met up with the Glory Run Road heading southward. You begin to come upon two familiar-looking mounds, hills that flank the sides of the road.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will message Caleb with my little wire and say: Do you think we should stop? You can reply to this message.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. I pull out my own wire and I aim towards Ophelia and say: Miss Denzala, we require a few moments on the side of the road here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She responds, "A quick pit stop, if that is what you require?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, ten, 20 minutes. Nothing more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well." The carriage at the front comes to a slow stop. The second carriage comes to a stop. As you all begin to step out of your spaces, the soft white hills and white fields and small elements of the slushy road immediately catch your vision. There, towards the southern side of the eastern hill, you see the single wooden cross embedded in the somewhat hard, cold earth. There, not yet removed from the cross, whether it be by luck or superstition, there is the white, snow-dappled, multicolored coat of Mollymauk Tealeaf.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I grab Jester by the hand and walk her over.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've never actually been to a grave before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not of someone I knew.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. That makes sense.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get down on my knees. I think he's still here with us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think so, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you, Molly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I grabbed his stupid cards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love those cards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want to draw one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb scoops Nott up out of the cart that she's in, and we watch from a distance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did I pull?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did she pull?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god, I got to think about this. I think you pulled the moon again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pulled this the first time I met him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Old faithful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, this is his card. I put it next to the little stick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Staring at the coat, I'll summon the new sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a strange exaggerated blend of the two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the way that I was taught by Vandren, I extend the sword to my side, bring it up in a salute, swing it back down. I've met a lot of people, but I don't think I'll ever meet another character as unique as you, Molly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What time of day is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about midday. As you look around at the nearby clouds, you glance back towards the cart, and you see, stepping out of the cloak of illusion, the leathered, conscious figure of Yasha, having shaken herself from the illusory binds. Groggy and confused, she steps towards the rest of you. "What's going on?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry, Yasha.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: While they were coming to rescue us--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We lost him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He tried to get to your side. He tried very hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Falls to her knees, her shoulders slumped forward, her hair, dark to white tumbling past the front of her torso. Turned away from you all. Just quiet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put my hand on her shoulder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I put my hand on the other one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you feel her shoulders quaking. You can't tell if it's tears, anger, whatever it is, it's emotion. You hear a growl. The growl gets louder and louder as she begins to stand up. All of you hear this echoing scream from the depths of Yasha's soul-- this mournful, baleful cry of anger and anguish-- shatter the still, cold air of this midday sky. The blackened, skeletal wings of her fallen aasimar form force both of your hands to recoil. She looks up to the sky. In the distance, you see two or three flashes of blue lightning from a coalescing storm far to the east. Her head lowers, without meeting any of your gaze. She puts her hand forward on the top of the marker, steps around it, and begins walking towards the storm.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She puts her hand up. "I'll find you when I'm ready." The wings flicker out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Knowing how young Nott is, I hold her closer and rest her head on my shoulder and walk away from this very painful thing to look at.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: May I? I'm going to walk up. Move a little bit of the snow and dig my hand as deep into the ground as I can, and attempt to do the full casting of Decompose and see what I get.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you going to make Molly tea?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) What's he doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You finish focusing on the cantrip. It feels like it sufficiently took root, although you do not see any difference, as it is a bit beneath the dirt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Something will be here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you just do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I made the earth remember him. Something will be here. I get back on the cart and leave them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've said it before, but I'm sorry we weren't here. To help. We haven't known each other that long, but you've shown us incredible kindness and care, and I'm very grateful for that. I will return the favor, if it's ever needed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've never had many favors done my way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It wasn't a favor, though. You guys are the only friends I've ever had. Most people in my life just leave. Anyone I'm not driving away. I guess I should probably try and start keeping people around at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I need to get myself some diamonds.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is an incredibly random thought.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's so that this doesn't happen again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think he would have been happy that you got to say goodbye. But we should keep going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (softly) Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come, everyone. Molly wanted us to keep living.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And make things better.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back in the carts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all turn around and begin making your way, crunching through the snow, outside of her carriage you see Ophelia Mardun, arms crossed, leaning against the outside of it. As you approach, she has a curious tilt to her head, and she goes, "I assume this is where you lost "someone? Unfortunate."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is always a cost.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Memories of what you've done here and times that you've first met and made whatever small impact and strange experiences this city had before, you've returned. So, Mighty Nein, what do you wish to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Out of game, how long have we been gone? When did we leave Zadash? We've been gone for--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At least three weeks, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Feels like a year.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know, but Caleb would know it exactly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb would know, and I'm sure CritRoleStats, too, would know. I will guesstimate, since the last time I checked in with them on this and the events you guys have gone through, you're three and a half weeks in. You're pushing somewhere, I'm guessing after all that eight days of travel coming down here-- a little bit less than that, probably. You guys were moving slow because you're moving carts, not on horseback. You're getting pretty close to the 30-day mark.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, since we spent so much time in those carriages, I would have spent a full day with my lucky rock that I found, and those ideas I had have come to fruition. I have set it just so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got a lucky rock?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep. That's what this game is about now, Travis.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have Luck again. I got a new feat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cheers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, man. Old trick's the best trick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Never again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what do you wish to do? You've returned to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to bring Ophelia to The Gentleman, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but hold on. Also rewind. Seven or eight days on the road, how much money do we all have?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I did the math between all the platinum and gold that we found, we should each get 163 gold pieces.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you break down the platinum?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 101 platinum, 131 gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not as much as I wanted.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait a minute. How much gold do I--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Including Yasha, who I assume took her share.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course she did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes. We threw it and it landed in her pocket when she ghosted out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I getting in this as well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're part of this as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow! That's awfully nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to have an introductory period. You stay for two weeks and then we give you your money.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems very prudent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where do I add money?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a currency tab.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Actions. Spell. Equipment and then touch on the icons of the coins in D&D Beyond.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait a minute, but didn't you guys steal some money from me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We took a bunch of your gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We took about 70 gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, of course not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We took 70 gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got a lot of tweets about it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thanks, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We took some of Molly's gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The internet's full of troublemakers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thanks, guys. That's the last time we let you be in on our secrets. So it's how much gold, how much platinum?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 163 gold. I just broke it down into gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But it's all platinum. Right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who cares?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He might.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, did we find a bank to break change on the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can say, if you'd like to, there are ways to transition the money. For ease, you can say gold piece value for keeping tabs on it, but you can say that a portion of it is platinum for ease of travel. Though you have a bag of holding; it's not a huge issue.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bag of holding is one of those items where eventually, when you reach a certain level, you're like, "You know what? Let's not worry about all that copper and silver and gold piece weight with you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We all have roughly 30-something platinum.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Be glad you rolled at least a 15 on that investigation check, or you never would have found a bag of holding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy Jesus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Detective!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled like crap, considering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know I don't show the notes there regularly, but that is the 15 plus investigation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't doubt you, Matt. We don't doubt you. I know you don't sleep. I know you stare at a computer monitor and think up numbers for us non-stop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I should be better about being a human being.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (robotic voice) It's all good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The carriages make their way, beelining, as if they know where to go, towards The Evening Nip.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we remember the code to get in? What is it? You say, like, "I need a drink."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "These pretzels are making me thirsty."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. What is it? "I am here to help."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like, "I need to speak to The Gentleman?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "I want some milk," or something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a phrase.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have it written down somewhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe Ophelia knows.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sure we're fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ophelia, do you know the secret code?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "I'd like to offer many gifts."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is indeed it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bitches.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I imagine the carts would come to a stop as well, those who are driving them. Ophelia steps out and her drivers hold view on this. Ophelia heads towards and waits at the doorway to The Evening Nip. One of her drivers comes up behind her with the bags that she had packaged in the carriage, and as you guys step off of them, one of the carriages is then brought around the back to The Evening Nip. She has her arms crossed. "Well, are you all coming?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, of course.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the gruff, dwarven bartender, Clive, look back at you. His chin chewing something on the inside of his mouth. "Ah, I was given word you "might show up. Most likely not, mind you, but word was given. Go ahead."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have many gifts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, right. No, I've seen you before."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but I do have many gifts, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, well bring them up."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It worked!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ophelia looks like she is trying to recall something. She's like, "It's round that way." She follows you in. It looks like she is trying to recall, like it's been a while since she's been here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go: Yeah, it's this way. That's to the bathroom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, I know. I remember."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As were heading down, I'll drop my Mask of Many Faces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find the trap door, open it, and you begin to descend the tight spiral staircase that leads into the under-chambers of The Gentleman's lair. As you reach the base of it, you can hear the sound of a lazy harp playing inside the stone-case chamber. Across the way, you can see the individual playing the harp is Kara, who's leaned against the bar on a stool. Her legs up on the edge of a table and just a little, small compact harp, which she is plucking away at lazily. Looks like she may have been imbibing early this day. The usual suspects fill two of the tables. The same ogre guardian eyeing you all with both familiarity and general mindless suspicion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kutha, how's it been?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, very talkative for him, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Consider our debt paid," she says to The Gentleman. "Now, I would like to see their debt paid, as well, for they have paid for their "service in blood." The Gentleman stands up at his table: "Of course, my dear, of course. I am sorry "to hear that." He looks amongst you all and looks over to you and gives a curious look, and keeps glancing about. "Ah. I see what she refers to. My apologies. However, that is the way of the "entrepreneurial sellsword, is it not? And--" He seems to be making a calculation in his mind for a moment. "We are on schedule!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you get my messages?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I did, and thank you very much. Actually, the storehouse is already up and running again, so thank you very much for the notification. That saved us some time, as well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the tree place, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is a way of explaining it, yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, Mr. Gentleman, sir, we didn't catch you at a bad time, did we? It seems that you just stepped out of the shower, or something? Should we come back after you've dried yourself off and made yourself presentable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the glimmer of confidence in his eyes sets into this glare for a second, and then he (laughs) "I'll be fine. Well, your contract is fulfilled. Ms. Mardun and I will take "the week to re-establish our trade line, and I think you've earned every copper." He looks over his shoulder and two of his various goons come over with a heavy chest. (strained grunt) onto the table. It hits with a very mighty strike and the whole table shakes for a second. They open it: it is filled with gold and platinum coins.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pay day!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing in, it's mostly platinum.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got hundreds, y'all!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pushes it forward, and it comes to about 600 platinum pieces and 250 gold pieces.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 3250 gold, it's platinum plus gold, around 600 platinum pieces times five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Times five?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Times ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Times ten? Even better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The remaining sum for the agreement you had made was 6250 gold pieces for both jobs being completed. He had paid some in advance and given you some funds, but this is the rest of the agreed upon amount.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hundred silver, y'all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think your math is off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He then reaches back into a small belt pouch that is carefully hidden on the inside of his belt, counts out a few coins and throws them across the table towards you. It looks to be another 50 or so platinum.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We got a tip?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this, a tip?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For your loss and your troubles."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is very honorable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm nothing if not. So you have a new companion that you've dragged into my sanctum?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has many gifts to offer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have no idea what's going on right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mr. Clay, this is "money" and you can use it to by things like goods or services.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of goods and services?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you know, like tailoring services.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you interested in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know what money is; I'm just having fun with Nott.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, but still, what are you interested in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know, I've never really thought about it before. Yeah, I can think of about four things I'd like to get. That's nice. Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure they have a lot of tea blends here in Zadash.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, and I could probably use a new tea set and maybe a new skillet--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You had three cups, so you need (counting).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, so are the four things to make a set of seven?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This ought to cover it just fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You like rings?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, regardless, you have two choices here: either we kill you or we take a bit of your "essence to keep tabs."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry about that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we probably should've told you that before we brought you in here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They all have a little collection of our blood in vials.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's just a formality. We need to protect our interests as much as yours. I hope you "understand, Mr.--? Miss? Whatever you'd like."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Clay. Mr. Clay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mr. Clay."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and get an insight check on this interesting individual. 23.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, secrets.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) Secrets.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, Laura?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, yeah, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do you like the new layout of the D&D Beyond app? I don't think you've used it yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, this is my first time looking at it, but I'll tell you what, it sure is... great.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My brain isn't working. I was trying to think of a word for--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boy, is it efficient! Everything I want is now in condensed--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Man, your schlocky bit is great and all, but it is really good to have you two at the table again. It'd only be better if Ashley was here, but it is really good to have you two back. Fucking for real. Ja, okay, as you were.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, but I'm going to need something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) "Curious. Tell me what you need."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I need you to promise not to do anything untoward with it. Whatever you're going to do and what you need it for, obviously everyone seemed okay with that. I need you to promise that you're not going to cast anything weird or-- you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You have my word as a gentleman."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Cree!" From around the corner, finishing a meal, the dark-furred, yellow-eyed tabaxi woman begins to approach, pulling a small satchel, pulling open the flap, and taking out a small blade.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can do it. I'm going to get one of my beetles to come out and bite my finger for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! How strange."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She pulls one vial out of her satchel, uncorking it. As she curls a finger upward, the blood seems to lift in a slow arc out of the wound, and drift, dancing through the air, and then into the vial, before it's filled to about halfway. The blood flow staunches, and it completes the vial to about three quarters. She corks it and puts it back into the satchel, closing it. "Thank you very much for your donation."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're welcome. I'm going to really quickly cast Eyes of the Grave. Are there any undead within 60 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Interesting point. No. No undead within 60 feet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel a little more comfortable knowing that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just wanted to check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cree turns to you and goes, "I hate to bother, but-- I'm happy to see you return. I see "that Lucien is not with you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is correct. He had his own business to attend to. We parted ways.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, boy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20. Thanks, Matt Colville!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been so brief since we've been reunited."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It didn't end well. It seems doubtful, but ja, if we see him again, rest assured.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. Anyway, it is good to see all of you. Welcome back. The Gentleman is pleased with "your success. Yes." Then turns around and shuffles her way back to where she was sitting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I ask a question, Matthew?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we know what day it is? Is it past Quen'pillar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's probably right on the cusp of Quen'pillar, because that shift happened with the Harvest Close festival, if I recall. I'll double-check, after the episode, to be sure it's the right answer. You're right on the cusp, if not right now entering to that month.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I get The Gentleman's attention and say: This adventure has been thorough. A name came up in our travels, and I was wondering if you may have heard of someone, a Marius LePual.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: (whispering furiously) What are you doing!?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah--" As you're talking to him, his eyes are locked over to Ophelia. "I can't say that "rings a bell, but I can certainly ask my contacts, if you're looking for information about this "individual. What was his name?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Marius LePwel. Pwal. P-U-A-L.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll look into it. Don't worry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Appreciate it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Pleasure is mine, Fjord. Anything else you require? Otherwise, I believe you have some money "to spend."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So much!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it still an open bar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "When is it not? Please, be my guests."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go to the bar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A round of liquor for all you'd like.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take whatever's not liquor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have any milk?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They do have milk. I've had it before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They do have milk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think I've ever had milk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasp) Oh, you have to try it. It's so good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try milk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not particularly chilled. It's thick, and creamy. It's your choice whether or not it's your preference based on how you lived most of your life.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is weird. I'm not sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's from a cow!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or a goat. It could be from a goat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could be a goat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could be from a mom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's just weird. It's very weird.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe just have some tea. They might have tea. Do you have tea?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then the barkeep, who's the ragged middle-aged man who's running the bar at the moment. One eye, you don't know if it's swollen shut or if he's missing an eye or he's just wanting to study you very closely with the left one. He leans forward and goes, "You're joking, right?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (forced) Ha! Yeah. (forced laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's funny, It's a funny joke, that's a really funny joke."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a good one. I've been working on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can tell. It's workshopped well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we'll just have some whiskey, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Whiskey, I got you whiskey." Puts a couple shots on the bar, fills them up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Try it, Mr. Clay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sniffs) Oh, that's a little strong.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's from the earth, though, they made it from grains.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sniffs) I'm not sure this is-- this doesn't--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They take wheat and barley and stuff and then they mash it up and let sit outside-- they let it decompose a little bit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Please Roger Rabbit--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I aware that Sam doesn't actually know how whiskey's made?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's how you do it! You take some, mash it together. Put it in a barrel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, god, I don't know any of this, do I? Okay. Yeah, sure, okay, apparently.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Drink it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's have a shot!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Finish getting angry at Sam. Here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Together, both tiny goblin Nott, with her rather large, comparatively, shot glass and very large Caduceus Clay, with a comparatively really tiny shot glass, both, in unison, slam back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
